event.descr:
The appliance is in the process of rebooting. The name of the user who initiated the reboot is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

A user logged into the appliance. The name of the user who logged in is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

A user logged out of the appliance. The name of the user who logged out is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

A video session has started. The name of the user who is connected to the session is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#2]%;

A video session has stopped. The name of the user who was connected to the session is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#2]%;

A video session has been terminated by another user. The name of the user who terminated the session is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was terminated from the session is contained in bvTrapObjectTargetUserName. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#3]%;

A user on the local port has started viewing a server. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#1]%;

A user on the local port has stopped viewing a server. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#1]%;

A local port session has been terminated by another user. The name of the user who terminated the session is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#2]%;

The appliance has started a TFTP upgrade of an image. The name of the user who initiated the TFTP image upgrade is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The type of image that is being upgraded is contained in bvTrapObjectImageType. The version of the image that the appliance is upgrading to is contained in bvTrapObjectImageNewVersion. The version of the image that the appliance is currently running is contained in bvTrapObjectImageCurrentVersion.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectImageType %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectImageNewVersion %parm[#3]%;

bvTrapObjectImageCurrentVersion %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: bvImageUpgradeStarted trap received bvTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectImageType=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectImageNewVersion=%parm[#3]% bvTrapObjectImageCurrentVersion=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The results of a TFTP image upgrade.

bvTrapObjectImageUpgradeResults %parm[#1]%;

A new user has been added to the local user database. The name of the user who added the new user is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The name of the new user is contained in bvTrapObjectTargetUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

A user has been deleted from the local user database. The name of the user who deleted the user is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was deleted is contained in bvTrapObjectTargetUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

A user was modified. The name of the user who modified the user is contain in bvTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was modified is contained in bvTrapObjectTargetUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

A user failed to authenticate with the appliance. The name of the user who failed to authenticate is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

An DSRIQ was added. The ID of the DSRIQ which was added is contained in bvTrapObjectDSRIQId.

bvTrapObjectDSRIQId %parm[#1]%;

An DSRIQ was removed. The ID of the DSRIQ which was removed is contained in bvTrapObjectDSRIQId.

bvTrapObjectDSRIQId %parm[#1]%;

The name of a server has changed. The previous name of the server is contained in bvTrapObjectOldServerName. The new name of the server is contained in bvTrapObjectServerName. The ID of the DSRIQ the server is attached to is contained in bvTrapObjectDSRIQId.

bvTrapObjectOldServerName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectDSRIQId %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvServerNameChangedTrap trap received bvTrapObjectOldServerName=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectDSRIQId=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The appliance has loaded a configuration file. The name of the user who commanded the appliance to load the configuration file is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The name of the file that was loaded is contained in bvTrapObjectFileName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectFileName %parm[#2]%;

The appliance has loaded a user database file. The name of the user who commanded the appliance to load the user database file is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The name of the file that was loaded is contained in bvTrapObjectFileName.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectFileName %parm[#2]%;

The appliance has detected an invalid connection. This can include two DSRIQ devices on a port where one or more have a legacy KVM Switch, or some other illegal setup condition. Information about the nature of the failure is stored in the bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition object.

bvTrapObjectDeviceId %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition %parm[#2]%;

The appliance has started a Subsystem Upgrade. This can be a download from the DModule to the Main Board, or a DSRIQ or other subsystem download from the Main Board... Information about the subsystem being updated is stored in the bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition object.

bvTrapObjectDeviceId %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition %parm[#2]%;

The appliance has completed a download and is restarting the subsystem specified in the bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition object.

bvTrapObjectDeviceId %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition %parm[#2]%;

The Appliance has detected a special condition resulting in a failed subsystem update. The condition has been recorded is stored in the bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition object.

bvTrapObjectDeviceId %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectFirmwareCondition %parm[#2]%;

A user account has been locked. The IP address of the client is contained in bvTrapObjectIPAddress. The name of the user who was locked is contained in bvTrapObjectTargetUserName. The reason for which the user account has been locked is contained in bvTrapObjectLockReason.

bvTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectLockReason %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvUserLockedTrap trap received bvTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectLockReason=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
A user account has been unlocked. The IP address of the client that originated the unlock request is contained in bvTrapObjectIPAddress. When the user account is unlocked by an appliance reboot or by the expiration of the lockout period (as specified in the bvTrapObjectUnlockReason object), the IP address will be blank. The name of the user who unlocked the user is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. When the user account is unlocked by an appliance reboot or by the expiration of the lockout period (as specified in the bvTrapObjectUnlockReason object), the name of the user will be blank. The name of the user who was unlocked is contained in bvTrapObjectTargetUserName. The reason for which the user account has been unlocked is contained in bvTrapObjectUnlockReason.

bvTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#3]%;

bvTrapObjectUnlockReason %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: bvUserUnlockedTrap trap received bvTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#3]% bvTrapObjectUnlockReason=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance is detected to be online. This trap is sent upon initialization of the SPC device if it is online and responding. Subsequent traps are sent if the SPC Device transitions from offline to online. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceCPSPort.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

The SPC attached to the appliance is detected to be offline. This trap is sent upon initialization of the SPC device if it is not responding. Subsequent traps are sent if the SPC Device transitions from online to offline. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

The SPC attached to the appliance has a login error. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The CPS Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The Login User name attempting to login to the SPC is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLogin.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLogin %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcLoginErrTrap trap received bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLogin=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance has been issued an On Command to a socket. The UserName of the person logged into the ASMP. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the CPS port is contained in cpsTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The SPC Socket Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#3]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcSocketOnCommandTrap trap received bvTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#3]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance has been issued an Off Command to a socket. The UserName of the person logged into the ASMP. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The SPC Socket Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#3]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcSocketOffCommandTrap trap received bvTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#3]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance has been issed an Reboot Command to a socket. The UserName of the person logged into the ASMP. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the CPS port is contained in cpsTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in cpsTrapObjectSPCDeviceCPSPort. The SPC Socket Number is contained in cpsTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#3]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcSocketRebootCommandTrap trap received bvTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#3]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance has an On Sense Failure. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The SPC Socket Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcSocketOnSenseFailTrap trap received bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance has an Off Sense Detect Failure (On Sense detected, but should be off). The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The SPC Socket Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcSocketOffSenseFailTrap trap received bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SPC attached to the appliance has a Total load high alarm. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

The SPC attached to the appliance has a Total load low alarm. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

The SPC Socket Polled Status changed state to On. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the DSR1021 port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The SPC Socket Number, or Port Name of the socket is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcStatusSocketOnTrap trap received bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SPC Socket Polled Status changed state to Off. The Location Name of the SPC attached to the BrancView port is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The DSR1021 Port Number is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort. The SPC Socket Number, or Port Name of the socket is contained in bvTrapObjectSPCSocket.

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectSPCSocket %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: bvSpcStatusSocketOffTrap trap received bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% bvTrapObjectSPCDeviceBvPort=%parm[#2]% bvTrapObjectSPCSocket=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The screen resolution of a target server has changed. The name of the user who is connected to the session is contained in bvTrapObjectUserName. The session identifier is contained in bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier. The previous screen resolution is contained in bvTrapObjectPreviousScreenResolution The current screen resolution is contained in bvTrapObjectCurrentScreenResolution

bvTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

bvTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#2]%;

bvTrapObjectPreviousScreenResolution %parm[#3]%;

bvTrapObjectCurrentScreenResolution %parm[#4]%;
